quote: Easy Trail, mostly clear. No issue on MTB.
Leisurely pace on cross bike with 38c tires. Would've been comfier with bigger tires. Good condition, a little mud on last 5 miles or so.
Lots of gravel roads. We went counter clockwise rather than clockwise. Some gravel packed and other loose. When on main road ride near fence.
We need rain! Never seen it this dusty.
First timer. Rainy day but nice loop in good shape.
First time riding the Sheets, rode on my cyclocross bike. Missed a turn, thus the longer distance. Saw an armadillo!
This loop provides an escape from Atlanta traffic to grind some gravel!
The terrain includes everything from hard-packed dirt roads to loose gravel sections
The route features approximately 90% gravel and 10% paved road, most of which is at the very beginning.
Some gravel packed and other loose. When on main road ride near fence.
It is recommended you download and follow the gpx file or use the MTB Project mobile app on your first ride, as there are several intersecting gravel roads you'll pass.

After passing Rico Park, you'll be on gated Upper Wooten Road. This is a public trail but is surrounded by private property, please stay on the road surface. This section of trail can sometimes be wet
The bridge is out on Garretts Ferry Road, but easily passable on a bike
It is recommended you download and follow the gpx file or use the MTB Project mobile app on your first ride, as there are several intersecting gravel roads you'll pass
Think of it as Silk Sheets' unruly counterpart—less refined, more rugged, and 100% unapologetic
Located just 30 minutes south of downtown Atlanta
Proceeds go to MTB Atlanta to build and maintain all that we're working on and will be working on
Post ride food, drinks and entertainment—of course—enough to make you happy and then some
Why is it called Dirty Sheets? This area is very popular with road riders in Metro Atlanta and is know as Silk Sheets. The gravel version of this ride is obviously the dirty sheets.
great Monday ride! Nobody around but me and the cows!
